title: Workshop on Analyzing Elementary Preservice Teachers' Difficulties in Solving Proportional Problems

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Parallel implementation of team-based collaborative learning and individual reflective assessments in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Prospective teachers can compare/analyze various proportional problem-solving strategies (ratio tables, proportions, cross-multiplication, etc.) and select approaches appropriate to student proficiency levels
Three or more specific potential difficulties students encounter during problem-solving (context comprehension, mathematical procedure application, etc.) can be identified
Team-based learning activities enable the creation and implementation of lesson design improvements incorporating peer feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
